org.missile.view
Class Canvas

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          java.awt.Window
              java.awt.Frame
                  javax.swing.JFrame
                      org.missile.view.Canvas
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Runnable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants, GameEngineObserver
public class Canvas
extends javax.swing.JFrame
implements java.lang.Runnable, GameEngineObserver

View layer of the application.

This class draws a JFrame, displays the elements of the game and listens for user actions. It knows as well how to render the different business objects.

Author:
Luis Carlos Mateos
See Also:
Serialized Form

paint

public void paint(java.awt.Graphics g)
Paint: Double buffering handler

That means that we need to create an offscreen image, draw to that image using the image's graphics object, and then calls drawImage using the target window's graphics object and the offscreen image.

Double buffering documentation

Overrides:
paint in class java.awt.Window

paintComponent

public void paintComponent(java.awt.Graphics g)
Draws all the screen elements on the JFrame and repaints the screen.

Parameters:
g - double buffer Graphics element. Needed to draw all the screen elements
